article.headline: MICHIGAN 63, OKLAHOMA 52
article.story: NORMAN, Okla. (AP) -- Kevin Bookout scored 19 points and Drew Lavender added 18 to lead Oklahoma past Cameron 91-56 in exhibition play Wednesday night. Bookout also grabbed 10 rebounds and had two assists, while Lavender had four assists for the Sooners. Arthur Trousdell paced Cameron, an NCAA Divison II school, with 18 points and seven rebounds. Both teams shot under 50 percent from the field, with Oklahoma hitting 34-of-68 (48.5 percent) for the game. The Aggies, who shot 35.7 percent in the first half and 36.4 percent for the game, trailed the Sooners 49-27 at the half.
